It was our first time here and won't be our last. Our guide was Nate and he was so knowledgeable and kind of funny too, haha.

Well you were right near the animals and it was feeding time so they were all out and about. We were so close to the end it was amazing. Our tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and super nice. We absolutely loved our tour.
Tour guide was amazing, and animals were close to us , we had a fantastic time. Would go again for sure.
We visited here in 2014. It nice to do once but you pay for it. I like the fact the animals have acres upon acres to roam.

This is the first time I have visited Safari West and I went with my 3 children (ages 5, 7, and 13). We all had a really great time!! Our guide was fantastic--do not remember her name, but she was so knowledgeable about every single animal. We learned a lot! The tour starts with about a 30-45 minute walk (with your guide) through the lower area which houses monkeys, cheetahs, and birds. Then, you board the vehicle and have the option to sit up top (seats 4). There were several families that wanted to experience the top seating, so the guide switched us around half way thru the tour. She drove us all throughout the park, getting up close with numerous animals! Zebras, giraffes, buffalos, and antelopes right next to the vehicle! After the tour, we had a really nice lunch from the "deli" on site and sat under a pergola overlooking the flamingos. We went in August and the temperature was low 80's yet it felt very pleasant and not overly hot. Living in San Diego, it's way too hot to visit our Safari Park in the summer, so this was very nice. FYI--when we exited the tour, everyone headed over to a buffet lunch that I didn't know existed from the website. Supposedly, if you want to eat a lunch buffet, you must make prearranged reservations. Since we did not do that, we simply bought snacks and sandwiches at the deli on site. This option was casual and I would assume less expensive than the reserved buffet. Overall, a great time and my kids' favorite activity from our Sonoma County summer vacation!
Show less

We had a great time at Safari West. We were worried that it would be expensive and that you wouldn't really get to see the animals up close. Boy, were we wrong! It was a very close encounter with an ostrich and a buffalo ! All the other cool animals were super up close too like the zebras, giraffes etc. Our guide Danny was wonderful. We asked lots of questions and he was willing to take his time, not rush, and give us a super knowledgeable and pleasant experience. I highly recommend SW. (we did not stay overnight but the facilities are super clean!).

Lunch after the safari was excellent. My husband really enjoyed the vegeterian "barbeque".
Overall everything was excellent and we will go back anytime. Maybe next time we'll spend the night.

Safari West is an AMAZING Place to Visit

When we went to Safari West we went on a safari ride in a real safari truck. Approximately 2 hours of riding and visiting all of the amazing animals (rhino's, zebra's, giraffe's, etc.). Our children loved them and there were certainly lots of oh's and ah's. It was well worth the money spent on this amazing adventure.

1) The Safari Website shows an elephant - w the jeeps surrounded by giraffe walking freely - no encounters - a pre-warning for parents via email would eliminate disappointment .2) Our tent - had no hot water.3) The buffalo, elan, zebra, kudo etc herds were impressive and close by the jeeps - with the tour guide fun and upbeat and accommodating - great fun.4) the aviary and flamingo pond were spectacular, as were the two mini-fox (adorable) 5) The tortoises were very active (surprising) while the (old) cheetahs were reclusive.(6) The BBQ items were terrific, with the side dishes a bit on the starchy side but certainly delicious. (7) the caged wildlife should be placarded for those wanting to return and see them again. 8) the tent experience was wonderful for the teens albeit they needed to have bunks because they don't sleep together at home - not sure how many bunked tents you have...need more?Thank you!
